executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 7.5%, which is above the target, indicating a need for improved glycemic control and lifestyle modifications.

labs_table.comment: Above target, indicating need for intervention.
LDL is above target, suggesting a need for dietary adjustments.

interpretation.assessment: HbA1c is at 7.5%, which is above the target for Type 1 Diabetes.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle changes and consider medication to improve glycemic control.

interpretation.assessment: LDL cholesterol is at 2.5, above the recommended target.
interpretation.plan: Recommend dietary modifications to lower LDL levels.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on low glycemic index foods, reduce saturated fats, and increase fiber intake.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Oatmeal topped with berries and nuts
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use the plate method: half the plate for non-starchy vegetables, a quarter for protein, and a quarter for whole grains.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and ketones.

patient_goals: Reduce HbA1c to below 7.0% within the next 3 months.
Lower LDL cholesterol to below 2.0 within 6 months.
Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes per week.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c and lipid levels, review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, currently with an HbA1c of 7.5%. Lifestyle modifications and potential insulin therapy recommended to improve glycemic control.
